Creation of new files with DLL extension.Data: Windows Event ID 4663; Windows Event ID 4688
Creation of new files with DLL extension.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 on target directories (requires SACL on C:\Windows\System32, SysWOW64). Identify new files with .dll extension by comparing file hashes or names against known good lists. Use frequency analysis on file creation events in these directories per host to identify rare occurrences (low frequency or outliers using box-plots).

Registry key modification to add or chan.Data: Windows Event ID 4657; Windows Event ID 4688
Registry key modification to add or chan.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 for modifications to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\Notification Packages. Baseline normal modifications (if any) using descriptive statistics on frequency and timestamps. Alert on deviations from the baseline and correlate with Event ID 4688 to identify the process and user account performing the modification.

Observation of a newly loaded or unautho.Action: Monitor Sysmon Event ID 7 (ImageLoad) events on servers, filtering for `Image` path ending with `lsass.exe`. Identify `ImageLoaded` file paths (DLLs) that are not on a pre-defined whitelist of legitimate DLLs loaded by `lsass.exe` or that haven't been observed loading before. Use set-based analysis or frequency comparison against historical data to identify unusual DLLs.

Anomalous outbound network connections o.Data: Windows Event ID 5156; Windows Event ID 4688; Zeek conn.log
Anomalous outbound network connections o.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 5156 for outbound network connections where `Process Name` is `lsass.exe`. Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 where `Parent Process Name` is `lsass.exe`. Correlate these events with Zeek conn.log filtering by server IP and destination ports/IPs from Event 5156 or by source process name `lsass.exe`. Baseline expected network/process activity for `lsass.exe` (should be zero or minimal) and alert on any observed connections or child processes. Characterize anomalous activity using descriptive statistics (count, destination ports/IPs, process command lines).

Registry key modification to Lsa\\Notifi.Data: Windows Event ID 4657; Windows Event ID 4688
Registry key modification to Lsa\\Notifi.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 for LSA key modifications. Correlate with Event ID 4688 to identify the process name and user account. Establish a baseline of processes/users that legitimately modify this key using historical data and frequency analysis. Use correlation analysis to identify unusual process/user combinations modifying this key that fall outside the baseline.

Attempted file write operations to prote.Data: Windows Event ID 4663; Windows Event ID 4624
Attempted file write operations to prote.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 on system directories (requires SACL) on Servers/Domain Controllers. Filter for write operations. Correlate with logon events (Event ID 4624) to determine the user session. Calculate the frequency of write attempts by different user account types in these directories and identify outliers using box-plots or percentiles compared to normal activity.

Observation of a newly loaded or unautho.Action: Monitor Sysmon Event ID 7 (ImageLoad) events on servers, filtering for `Image` path ending with `lsass.exe`. Identify `ImageLoaded` file paths (DLLs) that are not on a pre-defined whitelist of legitimate DLLs loaded by `lsass.exe` or that haven't been observed loading before. Use set-based analysis or frequency comparison against historical data to identify unusual DLLs.

Anomalous outbound network connections o.Data: Windows Event ID 5156; Windows Event ID 4688; Zeek conn.log
Anomalous outbound network connections o.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 5156 for outbound network connections where `Process Name` is `lsass.exe`. Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 where `Parent Process Name` is `lsass.exe`. Correlate these events with Zeek conn.log filtering by server IP and destination ports/IPs from Event 5156 or by source process name `lsass.exe`. Baseline expected network/process activity for `lsass.exe` (should be zero or minimal) and alert on any observed connections or child processes. Characterize anomalous activity using descriptive statistics (count, destination ports/IPs, process command lines).

Creation of new files with DLL extension.Data: Windows Event ID 4663; Windows Event ID 4688
Creation of new files with DLL extension.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 on system directories on Domain Controllers (requires SACL). Identify new files with .dll extension by comparing file hashes or names against known good lists. Use frequency analysis on file creation events in these directories on DCs to identify rare occurrences (low frequency or outliers).

Registry key modification to Lsa\\Notifi.Data: Windows Event ID 4657; Windows Event ID 4688
Registry key modification to Lsa\\Notifi.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 for modifications to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\Notification Packages on Domain Controllers. Baseline normal modifications and alert on deviations. Analyze the process (via Event ID 4688 correlation) and user account performing the modification using descriptive statistics on modification timestamps and source process/user.

Observation of a newly loaded or unautho.Action: Monitor Sysmon Event ID 7 (ImageLoad) events on servers, filtering for `Image` path ending with `lsass.exe`. Identify `ImageLoaded` file paths (DLLs) that are not on a pre-defined whitelist of legitimate DLLs loaded by `lsass.exe` or that haven't been observed loading before. Use set-based analysis or frequency comparison against historical data to identify unusual DLLs.

Correlate these events with Zeek conn.log filtering by server IP and destination ports/IPs from Event 5156 or by source process name `lsass.exe`.
